    • From a few sequences to a complex map in minutes

Add subfeats

Source: R/subfeats.R
add_subfeats.Rd

Add subfeats

add_subfeats(x, ..., .track_id = "genes", .transform = "aa2nuc")

Arguments

...

subfeat tables with names, i.e. blast=blast_df, domains=domain_df
.track_id

track_id of the feats the sublinks map onto.
.transform

one of "aa2nuc", "none", "nuc2aa"

Examples

genes <- tibble(seq_id="A", start=100, end=200, feat_id="gene1")
domains <- tibble(feat_id = "gene1", start=40, end=80)
gggenomes(genes=genes) %>% add_subfeats(domains) +
  geom_gene() + geom_feat()

#> No seqs provided, inferring seqs from feats
#> Transforming subfeats with "aa2nuc". Disable with `.transform = "none"`
